rights.description: Constitutional right of access to government records
rights.implementation_notes: UNIQUE: Constitutional protection at highest level of state law
rights.request_tips: Cite constitutional right when challenging denials - fundamental right

rights.description: Records officers must respond within 10 business days of receipt; should respond as soon as reasonably possible
rights.conditions: 10 business day maximum for standard requests
rights.implementation_notes: Response should be sooner when feasible
rights.request_tips: Agency must respond within 10 business days; cite 'as soon as reasonably possible' for faster response

rights.description: For expedited requests: 5 business days maximum when information benefits public
rights.implementation_notes: Half the standard response time for public benefit requests
rights.request_tips: Request expedited processing if information serves public interest; response reduced to 5 business days

rights.description: First 10 single-sided copies free; searches taking 15 minutes or less free
rights.implementation_notes: GENEROUS: Both search and copy protections reduce costs
rights.request_tips: First 10 pages and first 15 minutes of search are always free

rights.description: Must provide fee estimate if costs exceed $50
rights.implementation_notes: Prevents surprise bills for large requests
rights.request_tips: If fees will exceed $50, demand written estimate before work begins

rights.description: Three-tier appeal: Chief Administrative Officer (10 days) → State Records Committee (binding order) → District Court
rights.conditions: Must appeal within 30 days of denial
rights.implementation_notes: UNIQUE: Most comprehensive administrative appeal system in nation
rights.request_tips: Appeal denials to CAO within 30 days; CAO must respond in 10 business days

rights.description: Government Records Ombudsman mediates disputes between requesters and agencies
rights.implementation_notes: Alternative to litigation - informal dispute resolution
rights.request_tips: Contact Government Records Ombudsman for mediation before litigation

rights.description: Centralized statewide online Open Records Portal available at archives.utah.gov/opengovernment/
rights.conditions: Available for all state and local requests
rights.implementation_notes: UNIQUE: Centralized portal for entire state
rights.request_tips: Use statewide portal for convenient tracking and submission

rights.description: Electronic submission accepted via portal, email, or fax
rights.request_tips: Submit electronically for faster delivery and documentation

rights.description: Electronic access should be provided when feasible
rights.conditions: Agency must provide electronic format when feasible
rights.request_tips: Request electronic format to reduce fees and expedite delivery

rights.description: District court may award attorney fees to prevailing party; damages for willful and knowing violations
rights.conditions: Must prevail in court; willful violations for damages
rights.implementation_notes: Damages for willful violations create strong deterrent
rights.request_tips: If wrongfully denied, attorney fees and damages recoverable for willful violations

rights.description: Willful and knowing violation is misdemeanor
rights.conditions: Violation must be willful and knowing
rights.applies_to: Public officials who willfully violate GRAMA
rights.implementation_notes: Criminal prosecution possible for egregious violations
rights.request_tips: If denial appears intentional and willful, misdemeanor prosecution possible

rights.description: Burden of proof on governmental entity for non-disclosure
rights.implementation_notes: Requester does not need to prove entitlement
rights.request_tips: Agency bears burden to prove exemption applies

rights.description: Must redact exempt portions only; cannot withhold entire record if part is public
rights.conditions: Applies to all partially exempt records
rights.request_tips: If denied, ask whether any portion is disclosable; agency must segregate

rights.description: All records are public unless otherwise expressly provided by statute
rights.implementation_notes: Strong presumption in favor of disclosure
rights.request_tips: Cite presumption of public access - records public unless specific exemption applies

validation_metadata.primary_statute: Utah Code § 63G-2-101 et seq.; Utah Constitution Article I, Section 27
validation_metadata.notes: All rights extracted from verified jurisdiction-data.json file. Utah has exceptionally comprehensive requester protections including: (1) constitutional right of access, (2) three-tier appeal system (unique), (3) Government Records Ombudsman for mediation, (4) statewide online portal (unique), (5) expedited 5-day response for public benefit, (6) first 10 copies free + first 15 minutes search free, and (7) criminal penalties for willful violations.
